DataElement.preferredName: Composite Color Assessment Index Skin Lesion Severity Ratio Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Response using three consecutive Minolta colorimeter measurements at each site of skin disease, with readings from index lesions and adjacent clinically uninvolved skin compared to determine disease response. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Composite Color Assessment Index Skin Lesion
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Consisting of separate interconnected parts._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._The appearance of objects (or light sources) described in terms of a person's perception of their hue and lightness (or brightness) and saturation._A numerical scale used to compare variables with one another or with some reference number; a number used to select an element of a list, vector, array or other sequence._1. An organ and the enveloping membrane of the body; includes, in addition to the epidermis and dermis, all of the derivatives of the epidermis, e.g., hairs, nails, sudoriferous and sebaceous glands, and mammary glands. Subdivisions of the skin surround various body parts; as a whole, the skin constitutes the external surface of the body. 2. The rind, capsule, or covering of any body or part.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Consisting of separate interconnected parts.:The appearance of objects (or light sources) described in terms of a person's perception of their hue and lightness (or brightness) and saturation.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The appearance of objects (or light sources) described in terms of a person's perception of their hue and lightness (or brightness) and saturation.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Property.preferredDefinition: Index; a numerical scale used to compare variables with one another or with some reference number.:1. An organ and the enveloping membrane of the body; includes, in addition to the epidermis and dermis, all of the derivatives of the epidermis, e.g., hairs, nails, sudoriferous and sebaceous glands, and mammary glands. Subdivisions of the skin surround various body parts; as a whole, the skin constitutes the external surface of the body. 2. The rind, capsule, or covering of any body or part.:(LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change.

Concepts.definition: A numerical scale used to compare variables with one another or with some reference number; a number used to select an element of a list, vector, array or other sequence.
An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.
A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Skin Color Disease Severity Ratio Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: 1. An organ and the enveloping membrane of the body; includes, in addition to the epidermis and dermis, all of the derivatives of the epidermis, e.g., hairs, nails, sudoriferous and sebaceous glands, and mammary glands. Subdivisions of the skin surround various body parts; as a whole, the skin constitutes the external surface of the body. 2. The rind, capsule, or covering of any body or part._The appearance of objects (or light sources) described in terms of a person's perception of their hue and lightness (or brightness) and saturation._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness._Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system._Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Ratio <1.0 indicates disease improvement (requires confirmation by > or = 2 consecutive observations)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Skin Color Disease or Disorder Severity Ratio Category
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: 1. An organ and the enveloping membrane of the body; includes, in addition to the epidermis and dermis, all of the derivatives of the epidermis, e.g., hairs, nails, sudoriferous and sebaceous glands, and mammary glands. Subdivisions of the skin surround various body parts; as a whole, the skin constitutes the external surface of the body. 2. The rind, capsule, or covering of any body or part.:The appearance of objects (or light sources) described in terms of a person's perception of their hue and lightness (or brightness) and saturation.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather.:The ratio of two or more signals, typically between two channels.  Of type float. (caMAGE):Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.
The appearance of objects (or light sources) described in terms of a person's perception of their hue and lightness (or brightness) and saturation.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.
Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support protocol 07C0013 in CCR
